pr_title: Add flowcell location stratifier for CollectSamErrorMetrics

timeline.bodyText:
since there already is a tile stratifier, it woudl seem more consistent to just add x & y stratifier (or one stratifiyer for x and one for y?) and then use it in conjunction with the Tile stratifier
Is there a reason this cannot work?
timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: Not that I know of, I can try it out and see how it compares (in terms of speed) to the way it is configured currently
replies.author: mollysacks

timeline.bodyText: This method is actually inherited by OpticalDuplicateFinder from ReadNameParser, so for clarity better to use a ReadNameParser object since you're not doing anything related to optical duplicates here.
timeline.author: kachulis

replies.bodyText: ok, should I change that in the existing tile stratifier as well?
replies.author: mollysacks

timeline.message:
Update ReadBaseStratification.java

delete original location stratifier (replaced with x/y)

timeline.bodyText: perhaps a comment to explain why this field is static?
timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: also, I think it can be made final, right?
replies.author: yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: hmmm. I think that storing a map with all the names of the reads is not the best design....I suspect that each read will be reads, queried a few different ways (tile, x, y, etc) and then move on. so perhaps use a Cache instead of a full map? see picard/sam/SamErrorMetric/ReadBaseStratification.java:272 for an example.
timeline.author: yfarjoun
yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: since you are going to have both if and elseit would be easier to read the code if you removed the ! and switched the cases
timeline.author: yfarjoun
yfarjoun
yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: why does this ned to be serializable?
timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: Travis was failing with java.io.NotSerializableException: picard.sam.util.PhysicalLocationInt (https://travis-ci.com/github/broadinstitute/picard/jobs/434802169), making PhysicalLocation serializable solved the issue.
replies.author: mollysacks

replies.bodyText: so a comment, "needs to be Serializable since it is a field in ReadNameParser which is Serializable." would help here.
replies.author: yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: You should be able to clamp down on the template T here and make it an Integer, right? if in the future somebody thinks of non-integer positions, we can open it up again....
timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: and this will simplify the downstream
replies.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: oops I thought I already changed this! Sorry about that
replies.author: mollysacks

timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: There's one that isn't used, I'll delete it
replies.author: mollysacks

timeline.bodyText: without a maximumSize this doesn't actually evict any entries....
timeline.author: yfarjoun

replies.bodyText: what should I set as maximumSize?
replies.author: mollysacks

replies.bodyText: I dont' think it should matter much. I imagine that 1 would be enough....but we can use 20 to be "safe"
replies.author: yfarjoun

timeline.author: yfarjoun
yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: no need for this temp variable, b, just put the read....() statement in the if(.)
timeline.author: yfarjoun
yfarjoun

timeline.bodyText: since you don't control loc, and it isn't immutable, it would be better to copy over the contents into physicalLocationStored rather than keeping a reference...
timeline.author: yfarjoun
